result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony J Brantmeier

records.addlTxt: Plea date on November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:38 PM Defendant Tony J Brantmeier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C Turner in court for Tony J Brantmeier.  Inducement made.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Defendant does not wish to exercise her right to substitution.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for September 9, 2022.  
Minutes.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:51 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tony J Brantmeier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael C Turner appeared by video for Tony J Brantmeier. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

1:40 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tony J Brantmeier appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Luke Harrison appearing with the defendant. Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 08-01-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of domestic abuse injunction, possess fentanyl.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 07-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with D.B.V. and L.B.V and any persons at their residence, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office, in writing, within 24 hours of release  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-13-2022
